title: When You Play the Game Of Trompowsky, You Win, or You Die
description:
#agadmator A novel situation, as far as I know. Has anyone before seen a serious game where one side has two queens, both en prise and unprotected even, to the same enemy piece, with each queen being able to deliver mate in one upon the capture of the other? -- Jonathan Rogers (Kingpin 37, p21)

Follow Lawrence Trent on Twitter https://twitter.com/lawrencetrentim

Lawrence Trent vs Desmond Tan
"Tan Your Hide" (game of the day May-26-2015)
BCF-chT 0203 (4NCL) (2002), West Bromwich, rd 10 
Trompowsky Attack: Classical Defense. Big Center Variation

1. d4 Nf6 2. Bg5 e6 3. e4 h6 4. Bf6 Qf6 5. Qd2 d5 6. Nc3 c6 7. O-O-O Bb4 8. e5 Qd8 9. a3 Be7 10. f4 a5 11. Nf3 b5 12. a4 Bb4 13. Qe3 Bc3 14. Qc3 ba4 15. h4 Qb6 16. Rh3 Ba6 17. Rg3 O-O 18. f5 ef5 19. Qe3 Kh8 20. e6 f6 21. e7 Re8 22. Ne5 Ra7 23. Rg7 Kg7 24. Qg3 Kh8 25. Nf7 Kh7 26. h5 Rg8 27. e8Q
